file_content.text: Oh thank goodness! A visitor! It gets so lonely in here sometimes.
I would offer you a drink--but I ran out millennia ago, by my record. But we could play a game instead.
You don't look like a Jedi Master. What's going on?
Isn't this a Noetikon?
Well, I'm not a Jedi Master, which would explain your first statement, and as for the second--it's hard to say.
What is this place?
Where am I?
Now, that is a good question, but a difficult one.
I don't have time for games.
Don't be ridiculous.
And here I was thinking it would be just the thing to pass the time--but perhaps the truth of the matter hasn't dawned on you yet.
I'm guessing you activated what looked like some sort of ancient device--a holocron, maybe--and something went wrong.
You zigged where you should have zagged, and you ended up here.
How do I get out of here?
I need to go back.
I was trying to access the Noetikon of Secrets.
I don't understand.
Hmm... nope, can't say that name means a thing to me.
But whatever it is, you won't be able to access it in here. And there's only one way out.
I don't care how I ended up here, I only want to know how to get out.
Let me go right now!
Well, I suppose I could let you go. But you'd have to play a game with me, first--a game of questions.
Answer right, you're free. Answer wrong, and your strength becomes a permanent part of this place.
Those terms don't sound very fair, but I'll do my best.
All right.
You'd better start asking, then.
Let's get this over with.
Excellent! Such an accommodating guest!
I don't like the sound of that... but I guess I have no choice.
That's hardly fair.
Now you're beginning to understand!
Okay. The first question: How do you catch an answer?
Through hardwork, meditation and study.
You seek instruction.
You lure it out with a question.
You ask.
Too obvious I suppose. It's no fun when you get the answer right.
I'm not going to play your game.
I won't do this.
No, I'm sorry--that's not right.
Don't worry too much, though. There are still two more questions.
Next question: What does the wise person know?
The wise person knows all there is to know.
Everything.
What is right and what is wrong, what is true and what is false.
The truth.
Oh, dear. Wrong answer.
That means you pay the penalty.
Wrong again!
That looked painful. But don't fret--eternity in here is not such a bad thing.
The wise person does not know, but seeks knowledge, always.
Nothing.
Another right answer! You are so dull.
Ah, you got it right this time. How boring.
Last question: Soon this place will be overrun with enemies. What will you do?
None of this is real--these enemies will not harm me.
Let them come. [Meditate]
You are a fool. While you sit and meditate, your enemies trample you underfoot. You perish....
What are the enemies? What are their weaknesses? Where will they attack from?
I need more information.
No! I don't know the answers to these questions....
I will fight to the bitter end.
I will defend myself.
Wrong answer. You are overwhelmed and trampled underfoot. You perish....
